channel.title: Uwe Boll's Postal 2 Kickstarter
channel.description: Oh hey look what i found on this [url='https://www.vg247.com/2013/08/29/uwe-boll-takes-postal-2-project-to-kickstarter-wants-500000/']Article[/url] just came out from [url='https://www.vg247.com/']VG247[/url], Uwe Boll who bought you shitty movies based on video games like, House of the Dead, and Alone in the Dark, wants $500.000 of your money for his up coming film Postal 2 sequel project on [url='https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1544635303/postal-2']Kickstarter[/url].

item.title: Uwe Boll's Postal 2 Kickstarter
item.dc:creator: Diabolical
item.description:
amazingcomedy:

Yeah. The first Postal game was dark and psychological, unlike the second game. Seeing that kind of take on the series would be interesting to say the least.

Also, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QRzOU2YnJd8

Yes it’s a shame there is no good movie based on a video games as far as I know.

Read full topic

item.title: Uwe Boll's Postal 2 Kickstarter

item.description:
Good, I don’t want to see a Postal 2 movie, lol. I love the Postal series and liked Boll’s adaption, but personally, a film based off of Postal should be like this imo.

item.title: Uwe Boll's Postal 2 Kickstarter

item.description:
I bought Prince of Persia SoT shortly after it was released and didn’t really like it at all. Maybe I should try and replay it though, because everyone says it’s amazing.

Read full topic

item.title: Uwe Boll's Postal 2 Kickstarter
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
TheeGoatPig:

That’s not enough for me. WHY did you drive away halfway through. It isn’t a bad movie on its own right. It explains everything that happens pretty well. It doesn’t jump around so much that you can’t follow it. The exposition is worked into the story well enough. What was your problem with it that you couldn’t finish watching it?

Because movies aren’t just their scripts. The plot and dialog was solid from what I saw. Nothing else was.

k3nny1550:

You do realize the original Postal was basically intended to be one of the most offensive movies ever made? Honestly, it sounded like it was totally in the spirit of the anarchic, crude, and crazy games.

It was. It was probably the most spiritually accurate game movie ever made. It’s the Dredd of game movies. It sounds weird, but Postal was perfect for Boll. It was made for him to adapt it, and he was made to adapt it.

I mean, most people that have issues with the Postal movie have issues with the game, too.

Read full topic

You do realize the original Postal was basically intended to be one of the most offensive movies ever made? Honestly, it sounded like it was totally in the spirit of the anarchic, crude, and crazy games.

Yes I do, I read about it years ago, on IMDb about the plot of this movie, and also I never seen the film, and I don’t think I’ll ever want too, just because it damage he made to the other video games movie’s, don’t take it wrong way.

item.title: Uwe Boll's Postal 2 Kickstarter
item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
k3nny1550:

Also, TGP: Play the original Sands of Time. It’s even better than the film treatment and the platforming has aged quite gracefully. The banter between the Prince and Farah is also totally worth the price of admission alone. Which is ~$10 USD, by the way. So you have no excuse

I don’t like platforming.

Read full topic

item.title: Uwe Boll's Postal 2 Kickstarter
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
You do realize the original Postal was basically intended to be one of the most offensive movies ever made? Honestly, it sounded like it was totally in the spirit of the anarchic, crude, and crazy games.

Also, TGP: Play the original Sands of Time. It’s even better than the film treatment and the platforming has aged quite gracefully. The banter between the Prince and Farah is also totally worth the price of admission alone. Which is ~$10 USD, by the way. So you have no excuse

UPDATE:
So yeah I’m boycotting his Kickstarter campaign all the way, who’s with me?

varg.666:

Oh hey look what i found on this Article just came out from VG247, Uwe Boll who bought you shitty movies based on video games like, House of the Dead, and Alone in the Dark, wants $500.000 of your money for his up coming film Postal 2 sequel project on Kickstarter.

You do realize that if you didn’t mention the Kickstarter campaign, people here probably would not have known about it, right?

item.title: Uwe Boll's Postal 2 Kickstarter
item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
xalener:

I saw SOT in a drive in movie theater, and drove out half way through.

That’s not enough for me. WHY did you drive away halfway through. It isn’t a bad movie on its own right. It explains everything that happens pretty well. It doesn’t jump around so much that you can’t follow it. The exposition is worked into the story well enough. What was your problem with it that you couldn’t finish watching it?

Read full topic

item.title: Uwe Boll's Postal 2 Kickstarter
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
k3nny1550:

What, the Sands of Time adaptation wasn’t good for you? I thought it did quite well for what it was. Plus, the film’s script was written by Jordan Mechner (the game’s screenwriter and the original designer of the series), so there’s that.

I saw SOT in a drive in movie theater, and drove out half way through.

Read full topic

item.title: Uwe Boll's Postal 2 Kickstarter
item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
Bolteh:

What have they got to lose? Not like his films are used as promotional material for the game.

It makes it harder for them to make a really good movie based on their game when a real director that understands what he is doing and respects the source material comes up with a better idea down the road (just because game movies mostly suck doesn’t mean they always will).

Read full topic

item.title: Uwe Boll's Postal 2 Kickstarter
item.dc:creator: Bolteh
item.description:
What have they got to lose? Not like his films are used as promotional material for the game.

Read full topic

item.title: Uwe Boll's Postal 2 Kickstarter
item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
k3nny1550:

What, the Sands of Time adaptation wasn’t good for you? I thought it did quite well for what it was. Plus, the film’s script was written by Jordan Mechner (the game’s screenwriter and the original designer of the series), so there’s that.

I enjoyed Sands of Time, but I never played the games, so there is that…

Bolteh:

People actually think that Uwe Boll tries to make good movies? Making shitty movies is his trade, and he’s a frigging master in it.

He doesn’t want his movies to be good, he doesn’t want to make movies that do the original material any justice, he just wants to make b-film-quality movies because he knows there’s a market for it.

The fact that you worry so much that this Kickstarter might be going somewhere is proof enough that there’s an audience for his movies, whether you like them or not.

Just let it be and don’t watch the movie. Live and let live and all that jazz.

I know why he makes them, which is why I question the developers that allow him to mangle their works like that. What do they get out of his work?

Read full topic

The fact that you worry so much that this Kickstarter might be going somewhere is proof enough that there’s an audience for his movies, whether you like them or not.
